oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LARGE SCALE WAVE IMPACTS ON A VERTICAL WALL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hofland, Bas
Kaminski, Mirek
Wolters, Guido
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: vertical wall breakwater
large scale experiments
wave impacts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper treats new large scale measurements of pressure fields on a vertical wall under wave impacts. These measurements were done in collaboration with the Joint Industry Project Sloshel, aimed at sloshing in LNG tanks. Measurements are presented with a relatively high spatial and temporal resolution. The impacts are created by wave focussing at the wall. By changing the focal point with respect to the wall, the impact type was altered. The influence of the impact type on the pressures and forces on the wall at large scale is thus studied.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; structures.15
